##prompt_id: 1, type: segmented, sample_id: 1
********
#part 1
**Definition of Confidential Information and Its Scope**

For the purposes of this Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”), “Confidential Information” shall mean any information, data, or materials, whether oral, written, electronic, graphic, or in any other tangible or intangible form, disclosed by one party (“Disclosing Party”) to the other (“Receiving Party”) that is designated as confidential or that reasonably should be understood to be confidential given the nature of the information and the circumstances of disclosure. Confidential Information includes, without limitation, business plans, strategies, forecasts, analyses, financial information, pricing, trade secrets, technical data, research and development, software (including source and object code), inventions, product plans, customer lists and contact information, supplier information, marketing materials, processes, formulas, know-how, designs, drawings, prototypes, and any other information or material that relates to the current or future business, products, or services of the Disclosing Party.

The scope of Confidential Information covered under this Agreement extends to all copies, reproductions, summaries, extracts, notes, or other derivatives of such information, regardless of the manner or medium in which it is stored or communicated. Confidential Information also includes information received by the Disclosing Party from third parties that the Disclosing Party is obligated to treat as confidential. The obligations under this Agreement apply to Confidential Information disclosed before, on, or after the effective date of this Agreement.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information does not include information that: (i) is or becomes generally available to the public through no breach of this Agreement by the Receiving Party; (ii) is lawfully received from a third party without any obligation of confidentiality; (iii) is already known to the Receiving Party at the time of disclosure, as evidenced by written documentation; (iv) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information; or (v) is approved in writing for release by the Disclosing Party. The burden of proving that information is not Confidential Information rests with the Receiving Party.

The Receiving Party acknowledges and agrees that the Confidential Information is proprietary to the Disclosing Party and may contain valuable trade secrets and intellectual property. The Receiving Party shall use the same degree of care to protect the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information as it uses to protect its own confidential and proprietary information, but in no event less than a reasonable standard of care. The Receiving Party shall take all reasonable steps necessary to prevent the unauthorized use, disclosure, or publication of the Confidential Information. Furthermore, the Receiving Party shall ensure that any employees, contractors, affiliates, or agents to whom Confidential Information is disclosed are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as restrictive as those set forth in this Agreement.

This Agreement does not grant the Receiving Party any rights, title, or interest in or to the Confidential Information, except as expressly set forth herein. Any and all intellectual property rights in the Confidential Information shall remain solely with the Disclosing Party. The Receiving Party may not use the Confidential Information for any purpose other than as expressly permitted by this Agreement.

#part 2
**Permitted Uses and Restrictions**

- The Receiving Party may use Confidential Information solely for the purpose of evaluating, negotiating, or performing its obligations under the specific business relationship or transaction contemplated by this Agreement. Any other use is strictly prohibited.

- Confidential Information may be disclosed only to employees, officers, directors, agents, or representatives of the Receiving Party who have a legitimate need to know such information to fulfill the objectives of this Agreement and are bound by confidentiality obligations.

- The Receiving Party must take all reasonable precautions to prevent unauthorized access, use, or disclosure of Confidential Information, including implementing physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards.

- Confidential Information may not be copied, reproduced, or otherwise duplicated, in whole or in part, except as necessary to fulfill the purposes of this Agreement and with the Disclosing Party’s prior written consent.

- The Receiving Party shall not reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, or attempt to derive the composition or underlying information, structure, or technology of any Confidential Information.

- The Receiving Party is prohibited from using Confidential Information to develop, manufacture, or market products or services that compete with those of the Disclosing Party.

- The Receiving Party may not disclose Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, except as expressly permitted under this Agreement.

- If disclosure of Confidential Information is required by law, regulation, or court order, the Receiving Party must provide prompt written notice to the Disclosing Party and cooperate to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy.

- The Receiving Party is responsible for ensuring that any consultants, contractors, or affiliates who receive Confidential Information are contractually obligated to maintain its confidentiality to the same extent as required by this Agreement.

- The Receiving Party must promptly notify the Disclosing Party of any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information and take all reasonable steps to mitigate the effects and prevent further unauthorized disclosures.

- Confidential Information may not be used for personal gain, to the detriment of the Disclosing Party, or for any purpose unrelated to the business relationship between the parties.

- The Receiving Party is not permitted to remove any proprietary notices, labels, or markings on Confidential Information and must ensure such designations remain intact on all copies.

- At the request of the Disclosing Party, or upon termination of this Agreement, the Receiving Party must promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information, including all copies, notes, and extracts, and certify in writing that it has done so.

- The Receiving Party must not export or re-export any Confidential Information in violation of applicable export control laws or regulations.

- The Receiving Party may not assign or transfer any rights or obligations under this Agreement, including access to Confidential Information, without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party.

#part 3
**Term of the Agreement, Renewal, and Termination**

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue in full force and effect for a period of three (3) years, unless earlier terminated in accordance with the provisions herein. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time, with or without cause, by providing thirty (30) days’ prior written notice to the other party. Notwithstanding any such termination, the Receiving Party’s duty to hold Confidential Information in confidence and its obligations under this Agreement with respect to any Confidential Information disclosed prior to the effective date of termination shall survive for a period of five (5) years from the date of such disclosure, unless a longer period is specified for particular information (such as trade secrets, which shall be protected indefinitely or until such information ceases to qualify as a trade secret under applicable law).

Upon expiration of the initial term, the Agreement may be renewed for additional one (1) year periods by mutual written agreement of the parties prior to the expiration of the current term. The parties shall confer in good faith regarding renewal at least thirty (30) days prior to the expiration of the then-current term. Any amendment or renewal must be executed in writing and signed by authorized representatives of both parties.

Termination of this Agreement, whether by expiration or by notice, shall not relieve either party of any liability or obligation incurred prior to the effective date of termination. Furthermore, the Receiving Party’s obligation to return or destroy all Confidential Information remains in effect upon termination. If the Disclosing Party determines that certain Confidential Information requires ongoing protection beyond the stated survival period, the parties may negotiate and enter into a separate agreement addressing such needs.

In the event of a breach or threatened breach of this Agreement, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled, in addition to any other rights and remedies available at law or in equity, to seek immediate injunctive relief to prevent further unauthorized disclosure. The parties acknowledge that monetary damages alone may not be an adequate remedy for such breaches. The termination or expiration of this Agreement shall not affect the accrued rights of either party or any obligations that by their nature are intended to survive termination, including but not limited to, obligations relating to the protection of Confidential Information and dispute resolution.

#part 4
**Remedies for Breach**

In the event of a breach or threatened breach of this Agreement by the Receiving Party, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to pursue any and all remedies available at law or in equity to protect its interests and Confidential Information. The parties agree that the unauthorized disclosure or use of Confidential Information would cause irreparable harm to the Disclosing Party, for which monetary damages may not be an adequate remedy. Accordingly, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to seek immediate injunctive relief, including temporary restraining orders and preliminary or permanent injunctions, to prevent or curtail any actual or threatened unauthorized disclosure or misuse of Confidential Information, without the necessity of posting a bond or proving actual damages.

In addition to injunctive relief, the Disclosing Party may seek to recover actual damages, including but not limited to, consequential and incidental damages, arising from any breach of this Agreement. The Disclosing Party may also be entitled to recover any profits or unjust enrichment obtained by the Receiving Party as a result of the improper use or disclosure of Confidential Information. The Receiving Party shall indemnify and hold harmless the Disclosing Party from and against any and all claims, losses, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) incurred as a result of or in connection with any breach of this Agreement.

Furthermore, the Disclosing Party shall have the right to require the immediate return or destruction of all Confidential Information in the possession, custody, or control of the Receiving Party, and to obtain written certification of compliance with such request. The exercise of any remedy provided in this Agreement shall be without prejudice to any other right or remedy that may be available to the Disclosing Party, whether under this Agreement, at law, or in equity. The remedies set forth herein are cumulative and not exclusive of any other remedies that may be available. The Receiving Party acknowledges and agrees that these remedies are reasonable and necessary to protect the legitimate interests of the Disclosing Party and to ensure the continued confidentiality of sensitive information.

#part 5
**Jurisdiction, Governing Law, and Dispute Resolution**

This Agreement shall be governed by, construed, and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of [Insert State], without regard to its conflict of law provisions. The parties expressly agree that any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including its interpretation, performance, breach, or termination, shall be resolved exclusively through binding arbitration administered by the American Arbitration Association (“AAA”) in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted in [Insert City, State], and the language of the arbitration shall be English.

Each party shall bear its own costs and expenses in connection with the arbitration, except as otherwise provided in this Agreement or as awarded by the arbitrator. The arbitrator(s) shall have the authority to award any form of relief that would be available in a court of competent jurisdiction, including injunctive relief and damages. The decision and award rendered by the arbitrator(s) shall be final, binding, and enforceable in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Judgment upon the award may be entered in any such court.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party may seek interim, emergency, or injunctive relief from any court of competent jurisdiction to prevent or curtail actual or threatened unauthorized disclosure or misuse of Confidential Information, pending the final decision or award of the arbitrator(s). The parties waive any right to a jury trial and agree that arbitration is the exclusive forum for resolving disputes under this Agreement, except as otherwise expressly provided herein. Each party irrevocably submits to the jurisdiction of the courts located in [Insert City, State] for the limited purposes of enforcing any arbitral award or seeking interim relief, and waives any objection to venue or forum non conveniens.

##prompt_id: 1, type: segmented, sample_id: 2

#part 1
**Definition of Confidential Information and Its Scope**

For the purposes of this Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”), “Confidential Information” means any data or information, oral or written, disclosed by one party (“Disclosing Party”) to the other party (“Receiving Party”), either directly or indirectly, whether before or after the execution of this Agreement, that is not generally known to the public and that the Disclosing Party considers to be proprietary or confidential. Confidential Information includes, but is not limited to, business plans, strategies, existing and prospective client lists, marketing and financial information, technical data, inventions, processes, designs, drawings, product formulations, prototypes, manufacturing methods, know-how, trade secrets, software source and object codes, databases, algorithms, market research, internal reports, personnel information, contracts, pricing, business opportunities, and any other information, whether tangible or intangible, relating to the Disclosing Party’s business, operations, or assets.

Confidential Information may be in any form or medium, including written, electronic, oral, visual, or other tangible forms. Any information that is disclosed orally or visually shall be considered Confidential Information if it is identified as confidential at the time of disclosure and is summarized in writing and marked as confidential within thirty (30) days of such disclosure. Confidential Information also includes all notes, analyses, compilations, studies, summaries, extracts, or other materials prepared by the Receiving Party or its Representatives that contain, reflect, or are based upon, in whole or in part, any of the Confidential Information.

The scope of Confidential Information under this Agreement shall not include information that: (a) is or becomes publicly available through no wrongful act or omission of the Receiving Party; (b) is received from a third party without breach of any obligation of confidentiality; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information, as evidenced by written records; or (d) is approved for release in writing by the Disclosing Party. However, the burden of proving that any information falls within any of these exclusions shall rest with the Receiving Party.

The scope of confidentiality obligations under this Agreement extends to all affiliates, subsidiaries, employees, contractors, consultants, agents, and other representatives (“Representatives”) of the Receiving Party who may have access to the Confidential Information. The Receiving Party shall ensure that such Representatives are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as restrictive as those set forth in this Agreement prior to any disclosure. The Receiving Party agrees to use the same degree of care, but no less than a reasonable degree of care, to protect the confidentiality and avoid unauthorized use or disclosure of the Confidential Information as it uses to protect its own confidential and proprietary information.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information does not include information which the Receiving Party is required to disclose by law, regulation, or valid court order, provided that, to the extent legally permissible, the Receiving Party gives prompt written notice to the Disclosing Party to enable the Disclosing Party to seek a protective order or otherwise prevent or restrict such disclosure. The obligations and restrictions regarding Confidential Information described in this Agreement shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for the period specified herein.

#part 2
**Permitted Uses and Restrictions**

- The Receiving Party may use Confidential Information solely for the purpose expressly stated in this Agreement, such as evaluating a potential business relationship, and for no other purpose whatsoever.

- Confidential Information may only be disclosed to employees, contractors, or agents of the Receiving Party who have a legitimate need to know such information for the permitted purpose and who are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as restrictive as those contained herein.

- The Receiving Party shall not disclose any Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, except as expressly permitted by this Agreement.

- The Receiving Party shall take all reasonable measures to protect the confidentiality of the Confidential Information, including, but not limited to, implementing physical, technical, and administrative safeguards.

- The Receiving Party shall not copy, reproduce, or otherwise duplicate Confidential Information except as necessary for the permitted purpose and, in such case, all copies must be marked as confidential.

- The Receiving Party shall not reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, or otherwise attempt to derive any underlying structure, design, or source code from any Confidential Information.

- The Receiving Party shall not use Confidential Information to compete with the Disclosing Party or to solicit its customers, clients, or employees, either directly or indirectly.

- The Receiving Party is prohibited from using Confidential Information to develop or market products or services that are similar to or competitive with those of the Disclosing Party.

- The Receiving Party shall not remove, alter, or obscure any proprietary notices or confidentiality legends appearing on any Confidential Information.

- The Receiving Party must immediately notify the Disclosing Party in writing upon discovery of any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information, and cooperate fully with the Disclosing Party to remedy such breach.

- The Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information to the extent required by applicable law or regulation, provided that the Receiving Party gives prompt notice to the Disclosing Party and cooperates with any efforts to obtain a protective order.

- The Receiving Party shall return or destroy all Confidential Information, including all copies, upon the Disclosing Party’s written request or upon termination of this Agreement, and certify in writing such return or destruction.

- The Receiving Party shall not export or re-export any Confidential Information in violation of any applicable export control laws or regulations.

- The Receiving Party may not assign, transfer, or delegate any rights or obligations under this Agreement regarding Confidential Information without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party.

- The Receiving Party shall not incorporate any Confidential Information into its own documents, products, or intellectual property, except as expressly permitted in writing by the Disclosing Party.

#part 3
**Term, Renewal, and Termination**

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date indicated above and shall continue in full force and effect for a period of three (3) years unless earlier terminated in accordance with the terms herein. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the parties may mutually agree in writing to extend or renew the term of this Agreement for additional periods as may be necessary to fulfill the purpose for which the Confidential Information was disclosed. Any such renewal or extension shall be executed in writing and signed by authorized representatives of both parties.

Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time upon thirty (30) days prior written notice to the other party. Termination, however, shall not relieve the Receiving Party of its obligations with respect to Confidential Information disclosed prior to the date of termination. Specifically, the confidentiality and non-use obligations described herein shall survive for a period of five (5) years from the date of disclosure of each item of Confidential Information, unless a longer period is specified in writing for certain types of information, such as trade secrets, in which case those obligations shall continue for as long as the information remains a trade secret under applicable law.

Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement, the Receiving Party shall promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information in its possession or control, including all copies, summaries, and derivations thereof, and shall certify in writing to the Disclosing Party that it has complied with this obligation within fifteen (15) days of such expiration or termination. The Receiving Party’s obligations under this Agreement regarding the use and protection of Confidential Information shall continue as set forth above, regardless of any expiration or termination, with respect to all Confidential Information received prior to such date.

The Disclosing Party retains the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the Receiving Party breaches any material provision of this Agreement. In such case, the Disclosing Party may seek all available remedies as provided herein and under applicable law. The parties acknowledge and agree that termination of this Agreement shall not affect any rights, obligations, or liabilities accrued prior to such termination, nor shall it limit the Disclosing Party’s right to seek injunctive relief or damages for any breach of this Agreement by the Receiving Party.

#part 4
**Remedies for Breach**

In the event of any breach or threatened breach of this Agreement by the Receiving Party, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled, in addition to any other rights and remedies available at law or in equity, to seek immediate injunctive relief, including temporary restraining orders and preliminary or permanent injunctions, to prevent or curtail any actual or threatened unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information. The parties acknowledge and agree that monetary damages alone may be inadequate to fully compensate the Disclosing Party for the loss, harm, or damage resulting from a breach, given the unique and sensitive nature of the Confidential Information and the potentially irreparable injury such a breach could cause to the Disclosing Party’s business interests, reputation, and goodwill.

The Receiving Party agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Disclosing Party, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, losses, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees and expenses) arising out of or relating to any breach or alleged breach of this Agreement by the Receiving Party or its Representatives. The Receiving Party shall be responsible for any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information by its Representatives as if such breach had been committed by the Receiving Party itself.

If a court or arbitral tribunal finds that the Receiving Party has breached this Agreement, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to recover, in addition to any other remedies, all actual damages suffered as a direct result of such breach, including any consequential, incidental, or special damages to the extent permitted by law. The Disclosing Party may also seek an accounting and disgorgement of any profits or benefits obtained by the Receiving Party as a result of the unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information. The remedies set forth in this Agreement are cumulative and not exclusive, and the exercise of any one remedy shall not preclude the exercise of any other remedy available under this Agreement or applicable law.

#part 5
**Jurisdiction, Governing Law, and Dispute Resolution**

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [Insert State], without regard to its conflict of law principles. The parties hereby consent to and submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in [Insert County and State], for any legal action, suit, or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach thereof, except as otherwise provided herein with respect to arbitration. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if the parties mutually agree in writing, any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof, shall be finally resolved by binding arbitration administered by the American Arbitration Association (AAA) in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules then in effect.

The arbitration shall take place in [Insert City and State], and the proceedings shall be conducted in the English language. The arbitral tribunal shall consist of one (1) arbitrator mutually selected by the parties, or, if the parties cannot agree, appointed in accordance with the AAA rules. The decision and award of the arbitrator shall be final and binding on both parties, and judgment upon the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court of competent jurisdiction. Each party shall bear its own costs and expenses of arbitration, except as may be otherwise provided in the arbitrator’s award.

Nothing in this section shall preclude either party from seeking interim, emergency, or injunctive relief in a court of competent jurisdiction to prevent or curtail actual or threatened unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information, pending the final decision or award of the arbitrator. The parties expressly waive any objection to personal jurisdiction or venue in the courts identified above and agree not to assert any defense based on forum non conveniens or similar grounds.

#part 1
**Definition of Confidential Information and Its Scope**

For the purposes of this Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”), “Confidential Information” shall mean any and all information, whether written, oral, electronic, visual, or in any other form, that is disclosed or made available by one party (“Disclosing Party”) to the other party (“Receiving Party”), whether directly or indirectly, before, on, or after the date of this Agreement. Confidential Information includes, but is not limited to, business plans, strategies, operations, financial information, technical data, product designs, prototypes, software code, inventions, trade secrets, intellectual property, marketing strategies, customer and supplier lists, pricing information, personnel information, research and development activities, and any analyses, compilations, studies, or other documents prepared by the Receiving Party or its representatives that contain or otherwise reflect such information.

The scope of Confidential Information extends to any materials, documents, or data labeled as “confidential,” “proprietary,” or bearing a similar legend, as well as any information that, by its nature or the circumstances surrounding its disclosure, would reasonably be understood to be confidential. This includes any summaries, notes, or extracts prepared by the Receiving Party that are derived from or contain Confidential Information. The protections afforded under this Agreement shall apply regardless of whether the Confidential Information is expressly marked as confidential, provided that the Receiving Party knew or should have known that the information was confidential under the circumstances.

Confidential Information does not include information that: (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault or breach of the Receiving Party; (b) was lawfully known to the Receiving Party prior to disclosure by the Disclosing Party, as evidenced by its written records; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without reference to or use of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information, as demonstrated by written documentation; or (d) is lawfully obtained from a third party who is not under any obligation of confidentiality with respect to such information. The burden of proving that any information falls within one or more of these exceptions shall rest with the Receiving Party.

The scope of this Agreement also encompasses all discussions, negotiations, and communications between the parties relating to the subject matter of this Agreement, whether or not such information is ultimately incorporated into any final agreement or transaction. The Receiving Party acknowledges that the Confidential Information is proprietary to the Disclosing Party and has significant commercial value, and that unauthorized disclosure or use may cause substantial harm to the Disclosing Party. Accordingly, the Receiving Party agrees to use the highest degree of care, but in no event less than reasonable care, to protect the confidentiality of the Confidential Information.

For avoidance of doubt, the obligations of confidentiality set forth herein shall apply to all employees, officers, directors, agents, affiliates, contractors, and representatives of the Receiving Party who are given access to the Confidential Information. The Receiving Party shall ensure that all such persons are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as restrictive as those contained in this Agreement. The Receiving Party shall be liable for any unauthorized use or disclosure of the Confidential Information by such persons.

#part 2
**Permitted Uses and Restrictions**

- The Receiving Party may use Confidential Information solely for the purpose of evaluating, negotiating, or performing the specific business relationship or transaction contemplated between the parties, and for no other purpose.
- Confidential Information may be disclosed only to those employees, officers, directors, agents, or representatives of the Receiving Party who have a legitimate need to know the information to fulfill the purpose of this Agreement, and who are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as strict as those herein.
- The Receiving Party shall not disclose Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, except as expressly permitted under this Agreement.
- The Receiving Party shall implement and maintain reasonable security measures, including physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards, to protect the confidentiality of the information from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.
- The Receiving Party shall not copy, reproduce, or otherwise duplicate any Confidential Information, except as necessary to fulfill the purposes of this Agreement, and shall ensure that all copies bear appropriate confidentiality notices.
- The Receiving Party shall not reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, or otherwise attempt to derive the composition or underlying structure of any Confidential Information, including, but not limited to, software, prototypes, or technical data.
- Confidential Information shall not be used by the Receiving Party for any competitive purpose or to the detriment of the Disclosing Party, including soliciting the Disclosing Party’s customers, clients, or employees.
- The Receiving Party shall not remove, alter, or obscure any proprietary notices, labels, or marks on or within the Confidential Information.
- Confidential Information may not be exported or transmitted outside the jurisdiction specified in this Agreement without compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and export controls.
- If the Receiving Party is compelled by law, regulation, or court order to disclose any Confidential Information, it must promptly notify the Disclosing Party in writing and cooperate with any efforts to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy.
- Upon written request or upon termination of this Agreement, the Receiving Party shall promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information, including all copies, summaries, and derivatives, and certify such destruction or return in writing.
- The Receiving Party shall promptly notify the Disclosing Party of any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information and take all reasonable steps to mitigate the effects and prevent further unauthorized use or disclosure.
- The Receiving Party is prohibited from filing any patent application or seeking intellectual property protection based on or incorporating any Confidential Information without the express prior written consent of the Disclosing Party.
- The Receiving Party shall not use Confidential Information to develop, manufacture, or sell any product or service that competes, directly or indirectly, with the Disclosing Party’s offerings.
- The Receiving Party shall not commingle Confidential Information with information of third parties or with its own information in such a way that the Confidential Information loses its separate and identifiable character.
- Any permitted disclosure of Confidential Information to external advisors, such as legal counsel or accountants, must be subject to confidentiality obligations at least as restrictive as those set forth in this Agreement.
- The Receiving Party shall not make any public announcement, press release, or other disclosure regarding the existence or terms of this Agreement or the subject matter thereof without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party.

#part 3
**Term, Renewal, and Termination**

This Agreement shall become effective as of the date of the last signature below (“Effective Date”) and shall remain in full force and effect for a period of five (5) years from the Effective Date, unless otherwise specified in writing by mutual agreement of the parties. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the obligations of confidentiality and restrictions on use imposed by this Agreement shall continue with respect to any Confidential Information that constitutes a trade secret under applicable law for so long as such information retains its status as a trade secret. At the expiration of the initial term, this Agreement may be renewed for successive one (1) year periods upon mutual written consent of both parties. Either party may initiate renewal discussions not less than thirty (30) days prior to the expiration of the then-current term. If no renewal is agreed upon, the Agreement shall expire at the end of its term, but all confidentiality and non-use obligations with respect to Confidential Information disclosed during the term shall survive for the period specified above.

Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time by providing thirty (30) days’ prior written notice to the other party. Notwithstanding early termination, the Receiving Party’s obligations with respect to Confidential Information received prior to termination shall survive for the duration set forth herein, including any extended protection for trade secrets. Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Receiving Party shall, at the Disclosing Party’s option, promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information, including all copies and derivatives, and certify such return or destruction in writing within ten (10) business days. Termination or expiration of this Agreement shall not relieve either party from liability for any breach occurring prior to such termination or expiration, nor shall it affect any other rights or remedies available to the parties under law or equity. The provisions relating to confidentiality, permitted uses, remedies, governing law, and dispute resolution shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement as necessary to give effect to their intended purpose.

#part 4
**Remedies for Breach**

In the event of any breach or threatened breach of this Agreement by the Receiving Party, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled, in addition to any other remedies available at law or in equity, to seek immediate injunctive relief, specific performance, or other equitable remedies to prevent or curtail any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information. The parties acknowledge that monetary damages alone may be insufficient to fully compensate the Disclosing Party for the loss, harm, or injury arising from such breach, given the unique and proprietary nature of the information involved. Accordingly, the Receiving Party agrees that the Disclosing Party shall not be required to post a bond or other security as a condition to obtaining any such equitable relief.

The Receiving Party further agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Disclosing Party, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs) incurred as a result of or in connection with any breach of this Agreement by the Receiving Party or any person to whom the Receiving Party has disclosed Confidential Information. This indemnification obligation shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement.

In addition, the Disclosing Party shall have the right to recover actual, consequential, and, where permitted by law, exemplary or punitive damages arising from any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information. The parties agree that the remedies set forth in this Agreement are cumulative and not exclusive, and the exercise of any one remedy shall not preclude the exercise of any other remedy available under this Agreement, at law, or in equity. The Receiving Party shall promptly notify the Disclosing Party of any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information and cooperate fully in any investigation or legal proceeding arising from such breach. The parties further agree that the prevailing party in any action to enforce this Agreement shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs.

#part 5
**Jurisdiction, Governing Law, and Dispute Resolution**

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [Insert State], without regard to its conflict of law principles. Any disputes, controversies, or claims arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including its formation, validity, interpretation, breach, or termination, shall be resolved exclusively as follows: The parties agree to first attempt in good faith to resolve any dispute through informal negotiations. If the dispute cannot be resolved within thirty (30) days of written notice by either party, the dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration administered by the American Arbitration Association (“AAA”) in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules then in effect.

The arbitration shall take place in [Insert City, State], and shall be conducted by a single arbitrator mutually agreed upon by the parties, or, if they cannot agree, appointed by the AAA. The language of the arbitration shall be English. The arbitrator’s decision shall be final and binding, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Each party shall bear its own costs and expenses of arbitration, except as may be otherwise awarded by the arbitrator in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, including the provision for recovery of attorneys’ fees by the prevailing party.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party may seek temporary or preliminary injunctive relief or other equitable remedies in any court of competent jurisdiction, as necessary to protect its rights or Confidential Information, pending completion of the arbitration process. The parties expressly waive any right to a jury trial or to participate in any class action or representative proceeding relating to any dispute arising under this Agreement. This section shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement and shall apply to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law.

#part 1
**Definition of Confidential Information and Its Scope**

For the purposes of this Non-Disclosure Agreement ("Agreement"), “Confidential Information” refers to any data, material, or information, whether written, oral, electronic, visual, or in any other form, disclosed by one party (“Disclosing Party”) to the other party (“Receiving Party”), whether directly or indirectly, before or after the execution of this Agreement. Confidential Information includes, but is not limited to, business plans, strategies, financial information, forecasts, marketing materials, customer lists, supplier information, trade secrets, know-how, intellectual property, technical data, product designs, prototypes, inventions, formulas, processes, software code, algorithms, databases, system designs, technical documentation, and other proprietary information. Confidential Information further encompasses any notes, analyses, compilations, studies, or other documents prepared by the Receiving Party or its Representatives (employees, agents, consultants, or advisors) that contain, reflect, or are based on, in whole or in part, any such disclosed information.

The scope of Confidential Information extends to all information that is marked as “confidential,” “proprietary,” or with similar language at the time of disclosure, as well as information that should reasonably be understood by the Receiving Party, due to its nature or the circumstances surrounding its disclosure, to be confidential, even if not so marked. Oral disclosures shall be considered Confidential Information if they are confirmed as confidential in writing within thirty (30) days of disclosure.

However, Confidential Information does not include information that: (a) is or becomes publicly available through no wrongful act or omission of the Receiving Party or its Representatives; (b) is rightfully received by the Receiving Party from a third party without restriction and without breach of any obligation of confidentiality; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information; or (d) is approved for release by the Disclosing Party in writing.

The Receiving Party acknowledges that the Confidential Information may be valuable, unique, and proprietary to the Disclosing Party, and that unauthorized disclosure or use of the Confidential Information could cause irreparable harm and significant injury to the Disclosing Party. Accordingly, the Receiving Party agrees to hold and maintain the Confidential Information in strictest confidence, using at least the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own confidential and proprietary information of a similar nature, but in no event less than reasonable care.

The scope of Confidential Information also includes any feedback, suggestions, or improvements provided by the Receiving Party regarding the Disclosing Party’s products or services, to the extent such feedback incorporates or references Confidential Information. The obligations of confidentiality apply to all forms of disclosure, whether intentional or inadvertent, and to all media, including but not limited to written documents, electronic files, emails, presentations, and verbal communications.

In summary, Confidential Information under this Agreement is broadly defined to protect the Disclosing Party’s legitimate business interests and to ensure that all sensitive information, regardless of the form or medium in which it is disclosed, is covered by the terms of this Agreement, subject only to the specific exclusions set forth herein.

#part 2
**Permitted Uses and Restrictions**

- The Receiving Party may use the Confidential Information solely for the purpose expressly authorized in this Agreement, such as evaluating a potential business relationship or performing obligations under a specific project or contract, and for no other purpose.

- Confidential Information may be disclosed only to employees, agents, or contractors of the Receiving Party who have a legitimate need to know such information for the purpose stated above, provided that such individuals are bound by confidentiality obligations no less restrictive than those set forth in this Agreement.

- The Receiving Party shall not disclose any Confidential Information to third parties without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, except as expressly permitted herein.

- The Receiving Party must take all reasonable precautions, at least as protective as those it takes for its own confidential information, to safeguard the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information from unauthorized use, access, or disclosure.

- Confidential Information shall not be copied, reproduced, or otherwise duplicated, in whole or in part, except as necessary to achieve the purposes of this Agreement, and all copies shall be marked as confidential.

- The Receiving Party is prohibited from reverse engineering, decompiling, disassembling, or otherwise attempting to derive the composition or underlying information of any Confidential Information disclosed in tangible or intangible form.

- Confidential Information may not be used by the Receiving Party to compete with the Disclosing Party or for the benefit of any third party, whether directly or indirectly, without the Disclosing Party’s explicit written permission.

- The Receiving Party shall not use Confidential Information to solicit or interfere with the Disclosing Party’s customers, clients, suppliers, or employees in any manner that could be detrimental to the Disclosing Party’s business interests.

- If required by law, regulation, or court order to disclose Confidential Information, the Receiving Party shall provide prompt written notice to the Disclosing Party, allowing the Disclosing Party to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy prior to disclosure.

- The Receiving Party may retain Confidential Information only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes of this Agreement, after which all Confidential Information, including copies, must be promptly returned or destroyed at the Disclosing Party’s request.

- Any notes, summaries, or analyses prepared by the Receiving Party that contain or are derived from Confidential Information are subject to the same restrictions as the original Confidential Information.

- The Receiving Party shall immediately notify the Disclosing Party in writing upon discovery of any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information, and cooperate fully in any efforts to mitigate the effects of such breach.

- The Receiving Party agrees not to remove, alter, or obscure any proprietary notices, labels, or markings on any Confidential Information or related materials received from the Disclosing Party.

- Access to Confidential Information shall be restricted to only those individuals who are specifically authorized and require such access to perform the authorized purpose, and the Receiving Party shall maintain a log or record of such access upon request.

- The Receiving Party is prohibited from incorporating any part of the Confidential Information into any products, services, or intellectual property of its own or of any third party, except as expressly authorized in writing by the Disclosing Party.

#part 3
**Term, Renewal, and Termination**

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date specified herein and shall continue in full force and effect for a period of three (3) years unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions set forth below. Upon the expiration of the initial term, this Agreement may be renewed for successive one (1) year periods upon the mutual written agreement of both parties, unless either party provides written notice of its intent not to renew at least thirty (30) days prior to the expiration of the then-current term. The parties may, at their discretion, negotiate modifications to the terms of this Agreement as a condition to any renewal period.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party may terminate this Agreement at any time for any reason or no reason by providing thirty (30) days’ prior written notice to the other party. In the event of such termination, the Receiving Party shall, within ten (10) days of the effective date of termination, return or destroy all Confidential Information in its possession, custody, or control, including all copies, extracts, and derivative works, and certify in writing to the Disclosing Party that it has done so. Any termination or expiration of this Agreement shall not affect the Receiving Party’s obligations with respect to Confidential Information disclosed prior to the effective date of termination; rather, the confidentiality and non-use obligations set forth herein shall survive for a period of five (5) years from the date of disclosure of each item of Confidential Information, or for such longer period as may be required by applicable law or as specified in writing by the Disclosing Party for particularly sensitive information.

Termination or expiration of this Agreement shall not relieve either party from any liability or obligation that accrued prior to the effective date of such termination or expiration. The provisions regarding confidentiality, use restrictions, return or destruction of materials, remedies for breach, and dispute resolution shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement. The parties acknowledge that, in certain cases, such as with trade secrets, the obligations of confidentiality and non-use may survive indefinitely, in accordance with applicable law. The parties further agree to cooperate in good faith to address any outstanding matters related to Confidential Information upon termination or expiration of this Agreement.

#part 4
**Remedies for Breach**

In the event that the Receiving Party breaches, or threatens to breach, any provision of this Agreement, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to seek all remedies available at law or in equity to protect its interests and Confidential Information. The parties expressly acknowledge and agree that damages alone may not be an adequate remedy for unauthorized disclosure or misuse of Confidential Information, as such breaches may cause irreparable harm, loss of competitive advantage, and damage to business reputation that cannot be fully compensated by monetary damages. Therefore, in addition to any other rights or remedies that may be available, the Disclosing Party shall have the right to seek and obtain immediate injunctive relief, specific performance, or other equitable remedies from any court of competent jurisdiction, without the necessity of posting bond or proving actual damages, to prevent or restrain any actual or threatened breach of this Agreement.

The Receiving Party shall be liable for any and all losses, damages, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs of investigation) incurred by the Disclosing Party as a result of any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information by the Receiving Party or its Representatives. If the breach is caused by an employee, agent, or contractor of the Receiving Party, the Receiving Party shall be responsible for ensuring compliance and for any resulting damages. The Receiving Party further agrees to promptly notify the Disclosing Party of any breach or suspected breach, cooperate fully in any investigation, and take all reasonable steps to mitigate the effects of the breach, including retrieving or destroying improperly disclosed information and preventing further unauthorized disclosures.

Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as a waiver of any other rights or remedies available to the Disclosing Party, whether under this Agreement, at law, or in equity. The remedies set forth herein are cumulative and not exclusive, and the exercise of any one remedy shall not preclude the exercise of any other available remedies. The parties acknowledge that these provisions are reasonable and necessary to protect the legitimate interests of the Disclosing Party and to ensure the continued confidentiality of sensitive information.

#part 5
**Jurisdiction, Governing Law, and Dispute Resolution**

This Agreement shall be governed by, interpreted, and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of [Insert State], without regard to its conflict of law provisions. The parties expressly agree that any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including its validity, interpretation, performance, breach, or termination, shall be resolved exclusively through binding arbitration administered by the American Arbitration Association (AAA) in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator, mutually agreed upon by the parties, and shall take place in [Insert City and State], unless otherwise agreed in writing.

The parties agree that the arbitrator shall have the authority to award any remedy or relief that a court of competent jurisdiction could award, including injunctive or equitable relief, and that the arbitrator’s decision shall be final, binding, and enforceable in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Each party shall bear its own costs and expenses of arbitration, except as otherwise provided in this Agreement or by the arbitrator’s award. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party may seek interim or preliminary injunctive relief from any court of competent jurisdiction in [Insert City and State] to prevent immediate or irreparable harm pending the outcome of the arbitration.

In the event that any portion of this arbitration provision is deemed unenforceable or invalid, such portion shall be severed, and the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect. The parties hereby irrevocably consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the state and federal courts located in [Insert City and State] for any action or proceeding permitted under this Agreement. This section shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement.

**Definition and Scope of Confidential Information**

For the purposes of this Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”), “Confidential Information” refers to any data or information, oral or written, disclosed by the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party, whether before or after the execution of this Agreement, that is not generally known to the public and that the Disclosing Party considers proprietary or confidential. Confidential Information includes, but is not limited to, business plans, strategies, financial information, technical data, inventions, processes, designs, drawings, product specifications, software (including source and object code), hardware configuration information, customer and supplier lists, pricing and marketing information, contracts, internal policies, employee data, research and development activities, trade secrets, and any other information which, by its nature or by the circumstances of its disclosure, ought in good faith to be treated as confidential.

Confidential Information further encompasses all notes, analyses, compilations, studies, or other documents prepared by the Receiving Party or its Representatives that contain, reflect, or are derived from, in whole or in part, the Confidential Information provided by the Disclosing Party. The scope of Confidential Information includes all forms and media in which such information may be communicated or stored, whether tangible or intangible, and regardless of whether the information is specifically marked as “confidential” at the time of disclosure.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information does not include information that: (a) is or becomes generally available to the public through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) is already in the Receiving Party’s possession at the time of disclosure, as evidenced by written documentation; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information; or (d) is lawfully obtained from a third party who is not under an obligation of confidentiality to the Disclosing Party.

The parties agree that the Confidential Information disclosed under this Agreement may relate to ongoing business transactions, potential partnerships, product development, or other commercial activities. The Receiving Party acknowledges that any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information may cause substantial harm to the Disclosing Party and that such harm may not be adequately compensated by monetary damages alone. Therefore, the Receiving Party undertakes to use the highest degree of care in protecting the confidentiality of all such information, at least as great as the care it uses to protect its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event less than a reasonable standard of care.

The scope of this Agreement applies to all Confidential Information disclosed during the term of this Agreement, regardless of the method of disclosure, including but not limited to written, oral, electronic, digital, or visual means. The Receiving Party agrees to limit access to Confidential Information to those of its employees, agents, or contractors (“Representatives”) who have a bona fide need to know such information for the purposes authorized under this Agreement, and who are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as restrictive as those contained herein. The Receiving Party further agrees not to reverse engineer, decompile, or disassemble any tangible objects or software provided as part of the Confidential Information, nor to remove, obscure, or alter any proprietary notices contained therein.

This definition and scope are intended to be interpreted broadly to protect the legitimate interests of the Disclosing Party. Any ambiguity as to whether certain information falls within the scope of Confidential Information shall be resolved in favor of inclusion.

#part 1
**Definition of Confidential Information and Its Scope**

For purposes of this Non-Disclosure Agreement ("Agreement"), "Confidential Information" shall mean any data or information, oral or written, disclosed by either party ("Disclosing Party") to the other party ("Receiving Party"), whether before or after the date of this Agreement, that is not generally known to the public and that the Disclosing Party considers to be proprietary or confidential, including but not limited to: business operations, strategies, plans, products, inventions, processes, designs, drawings, engineering, marketing, financial information, client lists, trade secrets, know-how, technical data, software, source code, object code, algorithms, business relationships, pricing, proposals, contracts, and any other information or materials identified as confidential at the time of disclosure.

Confidential Information includes all forms and types of information, whether tangible or intangible, and whether communicated in writing, orally, electronically, or by observation. This includes all copies, reproductions, summaries, analyses, notes, or extracts made or derived from such information. Confidential Information also encompasses information disclosed to the Receiving Party by third parties under circumstances obligating confidentiality.

The scope of Confidential Information under this Agreement is broad. It covers all information that (i) is designated in writing as "confidential," "proprietary," or with a similar legend at the time of disclosure; (ii) is identified as confidential at the time of oral disclosure and confirmed as confidential in writing within thirty (30) days of such disclosure; or (iii) by its nature or the circumstances surrounding its disclosure, should reasonably be understood by the Receiving Party to be confidential, whether or not marked or designated as such.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information does not include information that: (a) is or becomes generally available to the public through no wrongful act or omission of the Receiving Party; (b) is lawfully received from a third party without breach of any obligation of confidentiality; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information, as evidenced by written records; or (d) is already known to the Receiving Party at the time of disclosure, as evidenced by written records. The burden of proving that any information falls within these exclusions shall rest with the Receiving Party.

The parties acknowledge that certain types of Confidential Information may be subject to additional protection under applicable laws and regulations, including but not limited to intellectual property laws, data protection laws, and export control regulations. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to limit or waive any such statutory protections.

The Receiving Party agrees to treat all Confidential Information with at least the same degree of care as it accords to its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event less than a reasonable degree of care. Confidential Information may only be used for the limited purpose expressly authorized by this Agreement and may not be disclosed, disseminated, or used for any other purpose without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party.

In summary, the scope of Confidential Information under this Agreement is comprehensive, encompassing all forms of proprietary, sensitive, and non-public information as described above, and the Receiving Party’s obligations regarding such information are to be interpreted broadly to preserve the confidentiality and proprietary nature of the information disclosed.

#part 2
**Permitted Uses and Restrictions**

- **Internal Evaluation:** The Receiving Party may use Confidential Information solely for the purpose of evaluating or pursuing a business relationship or transaction with the Disclosing Party, and not for any personal, commercial, or competitive advantage outside the scope of this Agreement.

- **Copying and Reproduction:** The Receiving Party may not copy, reproduce, or otherwise duplicate any Confidential Information except as necessary to fulfill the purposes described in this Agreement and with the same level of protection as the original.

- **Protection Measures:** The Receiving Party shall implement reasonable security measures to protect Confidential Information from unauthorized access, disclosure, misuse, or loss, including physical, technical, and administrative safeguards.

- **Legal Disclosure:** If the Receiving Party is required by law, regulation, or court order to disclose Confidential Information, it shall provide prompt written notice to the Disclosing Party to allow the Disclosing Party to seek protective measures or waive compliance.

- **No Publicity:** The Receiving Party shall not use the Disclosing Party’s name, trademarks, or other identifying marks in any publicity, press release, or marketing materials without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party.

- **No Modification:** The Receiving Party shall not alter, modify, or create derivative works based on the Confidential Information without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party.

**Definition of Confidential Information and Its Scope**

For the purposes of this Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”), “Confidential Information” shall mean any and all non-public, proprietary, or sensitive information disclosed by one party (“Disclosing Party”) to the other (“Receiving Party”), whether in oral, written, electronic, visual, or any other tangible or intangible form, and regardless of whether such information is specifically marked or designated as confidential at the time of disclosure. Confidential Information includes, but is not limited to, business plans, strategies, financial data, technical information, product designs, inventions, processes, software code, prototypes, know-how, trade secrets, customer and supplier lists, pricing information, marketing strategies, contractual arrangements, employee data, and any analyses, compilations, notes, or other documents prepared by the Receiving Party that contain or are based on such information.

The scope of Confidential Information under this Agreement is intended to be broad, encompassing all information that a reasonable person would understand to be confidential given the nature of the information and the circumstances of disclosure. Confidential Information also includes all copies, reproductions, summaries, and derivatives thereof, regardless of the format or medium in which they are maintained. The Disclosing Party may, at its sole discretion, designate specific documents or information as confidential by marking them as “Confidential,” “Proprietary,” or with a similar legend; however, the absence of such a designation shall not affect the confidential status of information that is otherwise reasonably understood to be confidential.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information shall not include information that: (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was already lawfully known to the Receiving Party prior to disclosure by the Disclosing Party, as demonstrated by written records; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without reference to or use of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information; or (d) is rightfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party who is not under any obligation of confidentiality to the Disclosing Party. The burden of proving that information falls within one of these exceptions rests with the Receiving Party.

The Receiving Party acknowledges that the Confidential Information is and shall remain the exclusive property of the Disclosing Party. The Receiving Party shall use at least the same degree of care in protecting the confidentiality of the Confidential Information as it uses to protect its own confidential and proprietary information, but in no event less than a reasonable standard of care. The Receiving Party agrees to take all reasonable measures, including but not limited to implementing physical, administrative, and technical safeguards, to prevent unauthorized access, disclosure, or use of the Confidential Information.

The scope of this Agreement extends to all Confidential Information disclosed between the parties both prior to and after the execution of this Agreement, and it remains in effect regardless of the form in which the information is communicated or stored. The Receiving Party further agrees to notify the Disclosing Party promptly upon discovery of any unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information and to cooperate with the Disclosing Party in any efforts to mitigate the effects of such unauthorized disclosure.

#part 2
**Permitted Uses and Restrictions**

- The Receiving Party may use the Confidential Information solely for the purpose expressly stated in this Agreement, such as evaluating a potential business relationship, and not for any personal benefit or for the benefit of any third party.

- Confidential Information may be disclosed to employees, officers, or agents of the Receiving Party only on a strict need-to-know basis, and only after such individuals have been informed of the confidential nature of the information and are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as restrictive as those in this Agreement.

- The Receiving Party shall not copy, reproduce, or otherwise duplicate the Confidential Information, except as necessary to fulfill the purpose of this Agreement, and all such copies shall remain subject to the terms of this Agreement.

- The Receiving Party is prohibited from reverse engineering, decompiling, disassembling, or otherwise attempting to derive the composition or underlying ideas of any Confidential Information, including software or technical data, without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party.

- The Receiving Party shall not use the Confidential Information to compete directly or indirectly with the Disclosing Party, nor to develop or market any products or services that are similar to or derived from those of the Disclosing Party.

- Confidential Information must not be disclosed to any third party without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, except as expressly permitted under this Agreement.

- If the Receiving Party is legally compelled by law, regulation, or court order to disclose any Confidential Information, it must provide prompt written notice to the Disclosing Party to allow the Disclosing Party an opportunity to seek a protective order or other remedy.

- The Receiving Party must maintain the Confidential Information in a secure manner, utilizing reasonable administrative, physical, and technical safeguards to prevent unauthorized access, disclosure, or use.

- Upon termination of this Agreement or upon request by the Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party shall promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information, including all copies, extracts, and summaries thereof, and certify in writing that such destruction or return has occurred.

- The Receiving Party may not remove, alter, or obscure any proprietary notices or confidentiality legends appearing on the Confidential Information or any copies thereof.

- The Receiving Party is not permitted to make any public announcement or disclose the existence or terms of this Agreement or any discussions related to the Confidential Information without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party.

- The Receiving Party agrees not to circumvent, directly or indirectly, any business opportunities, relationships, or contacts disclosed as part of the Confidential Information for its own benefit or the benefit of any third party.

- The Receiving Party may not use Confidential Information as evidence or otherwise introduce it in any legal or administrative proceeding, except as required by law and after giving the Disclosing Party prior notice.

- The Receiving Party is responsible for any breach of this Agreement by its employees, agents, affiliates, or representatives to whom Confidential Information has been disclosed, whether such disclosure was authorized or not.

- The Receiving Party must promptly notify the Disclosing Party in writing upon becoming aware of any actual or suspected unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information, and shall cooperate fully with any investigation or remediation efforts.

#part 3
**Term of Agreement, Renewal, and Termination Clauses**

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date, which is the date of the last signature below, and shall remain in full force and effect for a period of three (3) years thereafter, unless earlier terminated in accordance with the provisions herein. The parties may mutually agree in writing to extend or renew the term of this Agreement for additional periods as may be deemed necessary to further the underlying purpose of the disclosure or to accommodate ongoing business relationships. Any such extension or renewal shall be effective only if executed in a written amendment signed by authorized representatives of both parties.

Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time upon thirty (30) days’ prior written notice to the other party, provided that such termination shall not relieve the Receiving Party of its obligations with respect to Confidential Information disclosed prior to the effective date of termination. Notwithstanding the expiration or termination of this Agreement, the Receiving Party’s duty to maintain the confidentiality of the Confidential Information, and all restrictions on its use and disclosure, shall survive for a period of five (5) years from the date of disclosure for each item of Confidential Information, or for such longer period as may be required by applicable law or as specifically agreed in writing by the parties.

Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Receiving Party shall, at the Disclosing Party’s option, promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information in its possession or control and certify in writing to the Disclosing Party that it has complied with these requirements. Termination or expiration of this Agreement for any reason shall not relieve either party of any liability incurred prior to such termination or expiration, nor shall it impair any rights or remedies available to the Disclosing Party at law or in equity with respect to any breach of this Agreement. The parties acknowledge that any continuing or surviving obligations under this Agreement are essential to the protection of the Disclosing Party’s interests and the preservation of the confidential nature of the information exchanged.

#part 4
**Remedies for Breach**

In the event of any breach or threatened breach of this Agreement by the Receiving Party, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to seek all remedies available at law or in equity, including but not limited to monetary damages, injunctive relief, and specific performance. The parties acknowledge and agree that the unauthorized disclosure or use of Confidential Information may cause irreparable harm to the Disclosing Party, for which monetary damages alone may be an insufficient remedy. Accordingly, the Disclosing Party shall have the right, without the necessity of posting bond or proving actual damages, to seek and obtain immediate injunctive or equitable relief to prevent or curtail any actual or threatened unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information.

The Receiving Party agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Disclosing Party and its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all losses, liabilities, damages, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of or in connection with any breach of this Agreement by the Receiving Party or by any of its representatives, employees, or agents. The remedies set forth in this Agreement are cumulative and not exclusive, and the exercise by the Disclosing Party of any remedy shall not preclude the exercise of any other remedy, whether provided herein, at law, or in equity.

The parties further agree that, in the event of a dispute arising from a breach of this Agreement, the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover its reasonable costs and attorneys’ fees incurred in enforcing its rights hereunder. The Receiving Party acknowledges its ongoing duty to cooperate in any investigation or legal proceeding related to the unauthorized use or disclosure of Confidential Information, including providing access to relevant records and personnel. Nothing in this Agreement shall limit or restrict any additional rights or remedies that may be available to the Disclosing Party under applicable law in the event of a breach.

#part 5
**Jurisdiction, Governing Law, and Dispute Resolution**

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [Insert State], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including its validity, interpretation, performance, or breach, shall be resolved exclusively by binding arbitration administered by the American Arbitration Association (“AAA”) in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted in [Insert City, State], and the arbitration proceedings shall be conducted in the English language. The arbitral award shall be final and binding on the parties and may be entered and enforced in any court of competent jurisdiction.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party shall have the right to seek temporary, preliminary, or permanent injunctive relief or other equitable remedies in a court of competent jurisdiction located in [Insert City, State] for any actual or threatened breach of this Agreement involving misuse or unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information, without the necessity of submitting such claim to arbitration. In all other respects, the parties expressly waive their right to a trial by jury and agree that arbitration shall be the sole and exclusive forum for resolving disputes arising under this Agreement. Each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys’ fees in connection with the arbitration, unless the arbitrator determines that an award of costs and fees is appropriate.

The parties agree to cooperate in good faith to resolve any disputes informally before initiating arbitration or litigation. If any provision of this Agreement is found to be invalid or unenforceable under applicable law, the remainder of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect. This section shall survive expiration or termination of this Agreement.

##prompt_id: 2, type: segmented, sample_id: 1
